intro: Bradlea frutescens, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that are typically dark green in color. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Due to its rapid growth and invasive tendencies, it is considered a weed in many regions.
